docs.lead_paragraph: SERENGETI, Tanzania -- Every few days or weeks, depending on the health of its carburetor, the disposition of its driver and the state of the roads, an old mud-caked bus chugs across Tanzania, all the way from the little Indian Ocean port of Tanga over the highlands to the shores of filharzia-infested Lake Victoria.

headline.main: Peter, Thomas, Joseph, Josephine and Simba, And How They Waited All Day for the Bus; ' They Had Already Been Waiting Two Days'

docs.abstract: T D Allman article on day spent with 4 Masai natives waiting for bus in Tanzania; illus
